comments.author: Registered User

comments.text: Hemi voice better!﻿
comments.author: Артем Шаргородский

comments.text:
I've always thought that the challenger has been the underdog of the muscle 
cars line up compared to the mustang and camero, but I honestly think the 
challenger over the years has not only gotten better but is better than 
those other cars in my opinion. Yes it's not the fastest 0-60 or out 
performs the others but it's the soul of the car that makes better than the 
others. The other cars lack muscle car soul. And no matter how many hp or 
exhust sound you add to it to make it sound like it's old predecessor it 
won't compare. The challenge is the true and last muscle car in America, in 
today's day and age. I can't wait till I get mine. ﻿
comments.author: luisfnsc

comments.text:
Whoever did the subtitles in this otherwise great video did not have their 
act together.
Either English was not their first language, or there was some sort of 
disconnect along the way. In all, a great video nonetheless!﻿
comments.author: Classic63EType

comments.text: Love those intakes on the headlights !!! ❤❤❤👏👏👏﻿

comments.author: Old Soldier

comments.text:
Thank you America.

comments.author: Toggle Mutt

comments.text:
What kind of idiots still buy muscle cars in 2015? Lmao. 

Look today is about track racing this isn't the 60-80's most Americans 
don't drag race anymore. They prove their ball size by taking on a track. 
American auto fans are more concerned about nurburgring statistics than 
standing quarter miles or Bonneville salt flat runs. This car is asinine 
and it will get it's finally hammer nailed in by the c7 z06, viper SRT/acr, 
m4/5, Nissan gtr and other high end sports cars. 

Again only simple minded fast food employees and washed up jocks care about 
standing quarter mile drag races these days. Everyone else here in the 
US/Canada cares about track performance now. Also the look of this car is 
horrific it has horrible lines and a benign fat ass look like all 
challengers/chargers.

Have fun on the track boys I'll be passing you by in my m3 while you're 
holding on for dear life lol. Can't imagine how much the z06 will spank you 
on a track like leguna seca lmfao. ﻿
comments.author: Mike Hatten

comments.text:
hellcat  is the strong,the powerful,the fast? let me see

205mph-330km/h, 0/100=3,2s and cornering and breaking much better! very old 
aspirated lambo miura with about 330cv goes to 174mph/280km/h! lol but i 
still like this car. to be powerful ISN`T to be fast!﻿

comments.author: Neal Lance

comments.text:
This is a uniquely American muscle car not a sports/ track car. It is 
therefore stupid to compare with the 911 or GTR which are designed for the 
track. Its like comparing apples and oranges. That said Dodge did a really 
good job with this. That is why these cars are selling really well. In fact 
the Challenger has become Dodges lead selling vehicle. To all thos America 
haters who speak garbage about it there is a very strong following of 
American muscle cars around the world. ﻿

comments.text:
It is just crazy that you have to pay $60,000 for a sports car  ! Who the 
Hell can afford that ? who buys these cars except someone who makes 
$100,000 or more a year not your average Joe on the low wages today . No 
wonder young people have no interest in sports cars today or even older 
adults they just are not affordable not even at $35,000 too much money for 
these cars . The price makes it a no fun car ,you are either rich or stupid 
to pay this much for a car unless you enjoy being in debt for 5 years or 
more. I say the Hell with the Hellcat , I can get a nice restored 1960s car 
for under $18,000 or so. I do not need the speed or tickets either like 
this car, A waste of money in my opinion . Gone are the value of the dollar 
and 1960s muscle cars .Dodge motor company Thinks everyone makes big 
dollars do they look at the current economy ? though people buy this car I 
am amazed . I guess I am the only one not making a six figure income.﻿

comments.text:
Dodge never intended the horsepower to be 707, the hellcats original 
horsepower was around 800 but would not have been 50 state legal and didn't 
become so until 707. With that being said the hellcat still makes around 
750 crank horsepower as of now even though they claim 707.﻿

comments.text:
Some people stupid enough to compare it to something like a Porsche 911 
which is one of the best sports cars out there. Probably you didn't hear 
properly, challenges is not a sports car, it's more of a GT car, it's a 
muscle car, it's a pony car... So its more about drama and theatre and the 
sheer noice. Its not supposed to be compared with sports cars, because it 
has a class of its own... No one cares how much time it takes to reach 60 
or 100kms. Maybe in a porsche 911 we do, but in this, there's alot of other 
things to looks at instead﻿

comments.author: Gatora tor 11

comments.text:
Hey, so remember when, sometime back in the 1980s, somebody somewhere 
determined that the average American's attention span is so short that 
they'd only want to look at a particular scene for no more than 3/4 of a 
second? I really appreciate that you folks, over at Motor Trend, take into 
account those of us who would like to watch one particular event unfold 
completely uncut and uninterrupted by constant camera switching. Thank you 
for the bumper shot of the standing mile run, and thank you for not 
polluting it with 300 camera angle switches. Something like that, or a 
timed lap in one of your other shows, deserves to be shown unmolested.

Oh. And fantastic video, as always!﻿
